comment: I just read an article saying that anyone who makes over k is upper class. Does that sound right to anyone? I would consider that middle class. To me k would be upper middle and k+ is upper class.
amr:
# ::snt I just read an article saying that anyone who makes over k is upper class. Does that sound right to anyone? I would consider that middle class. To me k would be upper middle and k+ is upper class.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (r / read-01
            :ARG0 (ii / i)
            :ARG1 (a / article
                  :ARG0-of (s / say-01
                        :ARG1 (c / class
                              :mod (u / upper)
                              :domain (a2 / anyone
                                    :ARG0-of (m2 / make-over-12
                                          :ARG1 (k / k))))))
            :time (j / just))
      :snt2 (s2 / sound-01
            :ARG1 (t / that)
            :ARG2 (a3 / anyone)
            :polarity (a4 / amr-unknown))
      :snt3 (c2 / consider-01
            :ARG0 (ii2 / i)
            :ARG1 (c3 / class
                  :mod (m3 / middle)
                  :domain t))
      :snt4 (o / opine-01
            :ARG0 (ii3 / i)
            :ARG1 (a5 / and
                  :op1 (c4 / class
                        :mod (u2 / upper)
                        :domain (k2 / k))
                  :op2 (c5 / class
                        :mod (u3 / upper)
                        :domain (k3 / k)))))
